speed.notes: 28-30 knots sustained at 50% max payload (72 tons)

range.notes: 15,000 NM proven at 15-20 knot sustained cruise

sea_state_survivability.operational_limitations: None observed in Sea State 9 conditions
sea_state_survivability.notes: Exceeded WMO Sea State 9 criteria (winds >68 kts, wave height 40')

payload.notes: Crewed variant includes crew accommodations, research lab, upper deck superstructure

propulsion_system.configuration: Twin diesel engines, one per hull
propulsion_system.shaft_type: Straight shaft via gearbox and fixed coupling
propulsion_system.notes: Simple, dual-engine configuration for resilience and minimal maintenance

power_generation.notes: One generator per hull, capable of paralleling for 200 kW total

resistance_calibration.description: Empirical corrections to ITTC-1957 theoretical formulas based on 32,000 NM operational data
resistance_calibration.friction_correction_notes: 5% increase over ITTC-1957 for operational surface roughness (biofouling, paint degradation)
resistance_calibration.catamaran_interference_notes: 8% wave interference between twin hulls (validated via speed trials)
resistance_calibration.appendage_drag_notes: 12% appendage resistance (straight shafts, rudders, propellers, bilge keels)
resistance_calibration.air_resistance: Standard calculation (frontal area × Cd × 0.5 × rho × V^2)
resistance_calibration.validation_method: Cross-check power consumption logs vs. GPS speed data across 2,500 operational hours

propulsive_efficiency.notes: Fixed-pitch propellers optimized for cruise speed (17.5 kts)

stability_data.metacentric_height_notes: Estimated from observed roll period in Sea State 9 conditions
stability_data.transverse_stability: Excellent due to wide hull spacing (10m center-to-center)
stability_data.deck_wetness: Minimal even in Sea State 9 (catamaran tunnel clearance)
stability_data.sensor_platform_suitability: High - low roll/pitch amplitude for tracking systems

operational_highlights.loitering_missions: Extended loitering in support of US Government civil agency operations
operational_highlights.autonomous_testing: L3Harris ASView autonomy stack integrated and validated
operational_highlights.extreme_weather_performance: Operated in winds >68 kts, wave heights 40' (Sea State 9) with no damage or operational limitations
operational_highlights.crew_feedback: Highly stable platform, comfortable in heavy seas, excellent sea-keeping characteristics

unmanned_conversion_projections.description: Performance changes expected for unmanned variant (remove upper 2 decks)
unmanned_conversion_projections.weight_reduction_notes: Remove crew accommodations, research lab, upper deck superstructure
unmanned_conversion_projections.stability_improvement: Lower center of gravity → higher GM, improved Sea State performance
unmanned_conversion_projections.speed_improvement_notes: Lighter weight + reduced wind resistance → 1-2 knot speed increase
unmanned_conversion_projections.range_improvement_notes: 15,000 NM → ~16,000 NM due to weight reduction
unmanned_conversion_projections.rcs_reduction: Faceted geometry option for low-observable operations

autonomy_validation.umaa_version: UMAA 4 (upgrading to UMAA 6 by end of year)

certification_and_compliance.navy_certification: L3Harris ASView: Navy certified, Authority to Operate
certification_and_compliance.construction_standards: Built to commercial standards, upgradeable to Navy specs
certification_and_compliance.shipyard: Metal Shark Boats (20+ years, 2000+ vessels delivered)

data_quality.power_consumption_logging: Engine power output and fuel consumption logs
data_quality.environmental_logging: Sea state, wind speed, wave height observations
data_quality.crew_observations: Detailed logbook entries for performance events
data_quality.validation_method: Cross-correlation of GPS speed, power logs, and fuel consumption for resistance calibration
data_quality.data_confidence: High - 32,000 NM provides statistically significant sample across diverse conditions

notes: All performance data derived from actual operational logs (2020-2025)
32,000 NM represents one of the most extensive sea trial programs for a vessel of this class
Performance envelope proven across Pacific, Caribbean, and Atlantic ocean conditions
Sea State 9 survivability validated (winds >68 kts, wave height 40') - exceeds typical catamaran qualifications
Resistance calibration factors are conservative estimates based on fuel consumption vs. speed correlation
Unmanned conversion projections are engineering estimates pending actual unmanned variant testing
All data suitable for NAVSEA HC-MASC technical substantiation and proposal validation
